importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news report, indicating the time of the incident and the public announcement of Doug Martin's death.
The date of Doug Martin's NFL draft selection as the 31st overall pick in the first round of the 2012 NFL draft, marking the beginning of his professional football career.
The year in which Doug Martin had a standout season with 1,402 rushing yards and 6 touchdowns, earning him first-team All-Pro and Pro Bowl honors.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played professionally in the NFL, including his time with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the Oakland Raiders, shaping his legacy as a key player in the league.

keyTakeAways: Former NFL running back Doug Martin died after a struggle with police during a detention related to a home break-in in Oakland.
Martin was the 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL Draft and played six seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and one with the Oakland Raiders.
He accumulated 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over his career, was named first-team All-Pro twice, and was selected as one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history.
Martin became unresponsive during an arrest on Saturday, October 18, 2025, and died at a hospital; a cause of death has not been released.
The Oakland Police Department reported a brief struggle during the detainment, but no further details were provided.
Martin’s family asked for privacy during the grieving process, and Oakland Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, honoring him as an Oaklander with a distinguished career.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers acknowledged his legacy and impact on the franchise, recognizing him as one of its top 50 players in their 50th-anniversary celebration.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, a 31st overall draft pick in 2012 and a key player for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police during a custody operation related to a home break-in. He became unresponsive during the arrest on Saturday, October 18, 2025, and later passed away at a hospital. The Oakland Police Department reported a brief struggle during the incident, but did not release further details. Martin had a successful career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning All-Pro honors twice and being named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers history. His family requested privacy, and both the city of Oakland and the Buccaneers expressed condolences, highlighting his legacy and impact both in sports and within the local community.
title: Former NFL player Doug Martin died after struggling with officers while being detained
